Eric Muller Slide Collection ALBA.PHOTO.203 Collection processed by Tamiment Staff
Tamiment Library and Robert F. Wagner Labor Archives Tamiment Library and Robert F. Wagner Labor ArchiveElmer Holmes Bobst Library70 Washington Square South10th FloorNew York, NY 10012(212) 998-2630tamiment.wagner@nyu.edu
This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace 2017-08-11T16:00:05
Tamiment Library and Robert F. Wagner Labor Archives
Eric Muller Slides
Muller, Norman E.
ALBA.PHOTO.203
1 Linear Feet (1 box)
undated
Provenance
The slides were donated to the Tamiment Library by Eric Muller's son, Norman E. Muller in 2002.
Scope and Contents
This collection consists of ca. 300 black and white, 35mm slides; the images are of Spanish Civil War-era Spain and include scenes of wartime destruction, refugees, street and battlefield scenes, a bullfight, and village life. There are also a few shots of naval vessels on the coast of North Africa and a few images of snowy mountains. The many shots of Nationalist troops, Spanish officials, and individuals in German uniform suggest that the photographs might have been taken by a German visitor, touring Spain toward the end of, or just after, the Civil War. The slides were the property of Eric Muller, a professional photographer from Lynn, MA, who got them from a returning U.S. serviceman who had served in Europe in World War II.
Immediate Source of Acquisition
300 slides were donated by Norman Muller in 2002. An additional 8 slides were donated by Norman Muller in 2012. The accession number associated with this gift is 2013.048
Conditions Governing Use
Copyright (or related rights to publicity and privacy) for materials in this collection was not transferred to New York University. Permission to use materials must be secured from the copyright holder. For more information, please contact the Tamiment Library & Robert F. Wagner Labor Archives, tamiment.wagner@nyu.edu or 212-998-2630.
Conditions Governing Access
Materials are open to researchers. Please contact the Tamiment Library & Robert F. Wagner Labor Archives for more information and to schedule an appointment, tamiment.wagner@nyu.edu or 212-998-2630.
Muller, Norman E.
